abstract: Egyptian appeals court sentences Dr Raslan Fadl to two years of hard labor for manslaughter and three months for performing female genital mutilation on 13-year-old Suhair el-Batea in 2013, after which she subsequently died; it is first time criminal conviction has been given for practice in the country.
lead_paragraph: Officials said it was Egypt’s first criminal conviction for the practice of female genital mutilation, and related to the death of a 13-year-old girl.
snippet: Officials said it was Egypt’s first criminal conviction for the practice of female genital mutilation, and related to the death of a 13-year-old girl.

headline.main: Egyptian Is Convicted of Genital Mutilation
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Is Convicted of Genital Mutilation
